intro: Mutisiopersea hypoleuca, commonly known as the white-leafed mangosteen, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to the common mangosteen but have a distinct flavor. Its botanical features include smooth, glossy foliage and a tree structure that can reach heights of up to 15 meters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates with well-drained soil.
